bibl.title: A Teacher's Dipinto from Trimithis (Dakhleh Oasis).
bibl.note: Excavation of Columbia University, February 2006. - A 4th-c. house at Trimithis: the archaeological context (P.D.). - The dipinto (R.Cr. and D.M.R.). Consists of a series of at least 8 epigrams in elegiac couplets and hexameters, written by a teacher for his students.
bibl.seg: CRIBIORE Raffaella, Paola DAVOLI and David M. RATZAN, A Teacher's Dipinto from Trimithis (Dakhleh Oasis).
JRA 21 (2008) pp. 170-191, 15 figg. n./bl. et coul.

Excavation of Columbia University, February 2006. - A 4th-c. house at Trimithis: the archaeological context (P.D.). - The dipinto (R.Cr. and D.M.R.). Consists of a series of at least 8 epigrams in elegiac couplets and hexameters, written by a teacher for his students.
